question: From which of the following does the external urethral meatus develop?

A diabetic patient comes to the clinic with complaints of high-grade fever and a purulent discharge from a small opening in the perineal region. After examination, a diagnosis of abscess in the ischio-anal fossa is made. Which of the following structures forms the medial boundary of the ischioanal fossa?
Which part of the levator ani muscle plays a major role in maintaining fecal continence?
The placenta is composed of two parts: 5/6th fetal and 1/6th maternal. The maternal placenta is formed by which of the following?
Which of the following sites in the male reproductive system is associated with storage and maturation of sperms?
Which of the following is true regarding the blood supply of the prostate gland?
Which cells surround and nurture developing oocytes within the ovary?
What is the role of the enzyme aromatase in the female reproductive system?

A medical college student constantly feels overwhelmed and stressed about upcoming exams. She often thinks, ''I am going to fail; I am not good enough.'' What cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) technique would be most appropriate for her?
Mr. Xavier experiences a fear of public speaking, leading to avoidance of class presentations. Which cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) intervention would be most effective in addressing his fear?
Which of the following is related to the term ''chocolate cyst''?
The process of PCR involves the amplification of DNA at high temperatures without the need to add fresh enzymes at each cycle. Which of the following enzymes is used in this process?
In the DNA hybridization technique, a single-stranded DNA probe is allowed to interact with a complementary sequence in a sample. What is this specific type of hybridization known as?

While discussing a model of the pelvis, a student points out the levator ani muscle as one of the boundaries of the ischiorectal fossa. Which of the following correctly identifies the location of the levator ani muscle in relation to this fossa?

A 31-year-old female comes with a history of vaginal discharge. The discharge is green in color and is foul-smelling. On lab investigation, it is found to be due to pelvic inflammatory disease. Which of the following is related to this condition?

A female patient came to the gynecology outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of infertility. After lab investigation, it was found that the problem is with the conduction of sperms and ovum to the site of fertilization. What is the site of fertilization?
Which of the following is the predominant estrogen produced during the reproductive years?
Which of the following is primarily a prolactin-inhibiting hormone secreted by the hypothalamus?
Testosterone is produced by the Leydig cells of the testes. Which of the following stimulates its secretion?
The greater vestibular glands open into which of the following structures?

answers.option: Vestibule on each side of vaginal orifice

question: Which of these is an immediate precursor to progesterone?
Which cells of the ovary secrete estrogen in the follicular phase of the menstrual cycle?
As menstruation ends, estrogen levels in the blood rise rapidly. What is the source of estrogen?
Which one of the following ligaments prevents prolapse of the uterus?
A pediatrician notices a 4-year-old girl having stained underwear and grape-like masses coming out of the vestibule. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old girl experiencing pelvic pain was examined and a mass was found in her ovaries. The mass on excision was white with necrotic patches and had primitive mesenchymal cells of cartilage, muscle tissue, and foci of neuroepithelial differentiation. What is the most likely cause?
A mother of 3 children is admitted for a fourth C-section. She is counseled for a permanent method of contraception. Which of the following are permanent methods of contraception?
Which is the most important prognostic factor for the overall health marker and socioeconomic status of a country?
Gubernaculum remnant in females is known as:
From where do primordial germ cells migrate to become incorporated into genital cords?
Rifampicin inhibits which RNA enzyme?
The pudendal nerve and internal pudendal vessels traverse the ischiorectal fossa on:
Which artery supplies the main erectile body of the penis?
Which of the following structures forms the lateral wall of the ischiorectal fossa?
What is the primary erectile tissue found in the penis that contributes to erection?
Which one of the following structures provides the least support to the uterus?

Benign enlargement of the prostate is common in men older than 50 years, the cause is possibly an imbalance in hormonal control of the gland. Which of the following lobes of the prostate is hypertrophied as an etiological factor?
Reproductive organs are supplied by the branches that arise from the internal iliac artery. Which of the following are the homologous reproductive arteries in males and females?

answers.option: Superior vesical artery and internal pudendal artery
Inferior vesical artery and vaginal artery
Superior vesical artery and uterine artery
Inferior vesical artery and internal pudendal artery
Superior vesical artery and vaginal artery

question: The internal iliac artery is the main artery of the pelvis. Which of the following arteries is a branch of the internal iliac artery?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the bulbourethral glands?

answers.option: They lie in deep perineal pouch
Their duct pierces the superior layer of urogenital diaphragm
Their duct opens into membranous urethra
They lie anterior to the sphincter urethral muscle

question: A 45-year-old woman with a history of abnormal uterine bleeding underwent a biopsy of her endometrium, which showed dilated and highly convoluted endometrial glands. What is the most likely phase of the menstrual cycle depicted by these findings?
A 25-year-old female underwent cervical examination and her biopsy smear revealed normal histology exam for ectocervix. Which of the following is true for the lining epithelium of ectocervix?

A group of medical students researched the histological features of ovaries at different ages of females. The ovaries of a young girl who has not reached puberty have somewhat different histological features. Which one of the following is not the part of a young girl who has not reached puberty?
Sertoli cells, a part of the walls of seminiferous tubules, are derived from which of the following?

answers.option: Surface epithelium of the testis (mesothelial cells)

question: Which of the following structures contributes most significantly to the development of the placenta?

A 20-year-old female presents with primary amenorrhea and cyclic pelvic pain. On examination, secondary sexual characteristics are normal. Imaging reveals a normal uterus and ovaries, but an absence of the lower third of the vagina. Which of the following developmental abnormalities is most likely responsible for her condition?

answers.option: Incomplete fusion of the paramesonephric ducts
Excessive regression of the mesonephric ducts
Absence of migration of primordial germ cells
Failure of canalization of the vaginal plate
Failure of the paramesonephric ducts to form

question: Physical examination of a newborn delivered at 38 weeks gestation showed a urethral opening on the ventral aspect of the penis. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient’s findings?

A 15-year-old girl was brought to the clinic with the complaint that “menses have not occurred yet.” A pelvic ultrasound was done that revealed normal ovaries but an absent uterus. Defect in which of the following embryonic structures may be the cause of her condition?
Which of the following structures in females is a derivative of Müllerian ducts?
The placental barrier after the first trimester or after 4th months of intrauterine life is composed of:

answers.option: Syncytiotrophoblast, mesenchymal tissues, and endothelium of blood vessels
Cytotrophoblast, syncytiotrophoblast, and endothelium of blood vessels
Cytotrophoblast, mesenchymal tissues, and endothelium of blood vessels

question: Which of the following is not a correct match of the genital structures and their remnants?

answers.option: Cranial PMN duct — appendix of testis

question: A 45-year-old male has a history of reduced libido and difficulty achieving erections. Blood tests show a decreased level of testosterone, while his follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and LH are also low. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The structural property of the DNA double helix is best characterized by which of the following statements?

answers.option: DNA is single-stranded in prokaryotic cells
Two strands are parallel and run in the same direction
Adenine pairs with thymine through two hydrogen bonds
DNA strands are held together by covalent bonds between the nitrogenous bases

question: Which of the following correctly describes the synthesis of the lagging strand during DNA replication?

answers.option: It is synthesized discontinuously in the 3' to 5' direction as Okazaki fragments
It is synthesized by helicase rather than DNA polymerase
It is synthesized discontinuously in the 5' to 3' direction as Okazaki fragments
It is synthesized continuously in the 3' to 5' direction
It is synthesized continuously in the 5' to 3' direction

question: Which of the following hormones is responsible for the thickening of the endometrial lining in the proliferative phase of the menstrual cycle?
What is the fate of the corpus luteum if fertilization does not occur?

answers.option: Becomes the corpus luteum of pregnancy
Continues to secrete estrogen and progesterone

question: Which of the following hormones is produced by the corpus luteum following ovulation and is critical for the maintenance of the endometrial lining?
What is the primary function of the zona pellucida during fertilization?
A 25-year-old woman presents with galactorrhea, oligomenorrhea, and headaches. MRI reveals a pituitary adenoma. What is the most likely cause of her symptoms?

A 35-year-old male is diagnosed with low sperm count and a high FSH level. His testosterone levels are within the normal range. What does this most likely indicate?
Which of the following best explains the mechanism by which testosterone influences spermatogenesis?

answers.option: Preventing the conversion of testosterone to dihydrotestosterone
Inhibiting LH secretion from the pituitary
Stimulating Sertoli cells to promote sperm maturation

question: A 30-year-old woman presents with oligomenorrhea and hirsutism. Her LH:FSH ratio is 3:1, and ultrasound shows multiple ovarian cysts. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A male patient presents with low libido and erectile dysfunction. His laboratory results reveal a low testosterone level, but his prolactin level is normal. Further testing shows elevated LH and FSH. What is the most likely cause of his condition?
A 38-year-old woman presents with symptoms of hot flashes, vaginal dryness, and irregular menstrual cycles. Blood tests show low estradiol and elevated FSH. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Veins in the pelvic region drain into larger venous structures before reaching the heart. Which of the following veins drains the pelvic venous plexus?
The ischiorectal fossa is a fat-filled space located on either side of the anal canal. Which structure is found within the ischiorectal fossa?

The perineum is innervated by several cutaneous nerves that arise from the sacral and lumbar plexuses. Which nerve is primarily responsible for the sensory innervation of the scrotum and labia majora?

A 30-year-old female presents with pain and swelling in the perineal region following a fall on a sharp object. Examination reveals an injury to the structures in the superficial perineal pouch. Which of the following structures is most likely involved?
Phenylketonuria is a genetic disorder due to a deficiency of which of the following enzymes?
Estrogen hormones have many reproductive and metabolic functions. Which of the following is the best option concerning estrogen?
In eukaryotes, translation is initiated by the binding of the ribosome to which of the following?
Many hormones play a role in reproduction and menstruation. The female hormone required for ovulation and formation of the corpus luteum is:
Transcription is the process of transferring genetic information from:

A 28-year-old pregnant woman, in her second trimester (24 weeks gestation), visits the antenatal clinic. She reports feeling fatigued and has a low hemoglobin level (10 g/dL). She mentions that her diet mainly consists of rice, bread, and occasional vegetables, with minimal intake of meat or dairy. On examination, she is otherwise healthy, and her BMI is within the normal range for pregnancy. Which of the following best explains the changes in nutrient and energy requirements during pregnancy?

answers.option: Decreased fat intake to prevent excessive maternal weight gain
Increased caloric requirements to meet the demands of pregnancy, focusing on carbohydrates as the primary energy source
No significant change in nutrient requirements during pregnancy
Increased iron requirements due to expanded maternal blood volume and fetal needs
Increased protein intake to support fetal development and maintain maternal muscle mass

question: A medical researcher is investigating a suspected case of cystic fibrosis caused by a mutation in the CFTR gene. To confirm the diagnosis, they performed PCR amplification of the patient’s CFTR gene region, followed by agarose gel electrophoresis to analyze the PCR product. The gel electrophoresis result shows the following: (I) A single band at 200 base pairs (bp) in the patient sample. (II) The control sample (without the mutation) shows a single band at 300 bp. (III) A DNA ladder is included, showing bands at 100 bp, 200 bp, 300 bp, and 400 bp. What is the likely interpretation of the gel electrophoresis result?

answers.option: The patient’s CFTR gene has a point mutation, which does not affect the PCR product size
The patient’s CFTR gene has a duplication mutation, resulting in a larger PCR product
The patient’s CFTR gene has a deletion mutation, resulting in a smaller PCR product
The PCR reaction failed for the patient sample, as the band size does not match the control
The patient’s CFTR gene is normal, as a band was successfully amplified

question: Which of the following is the typical peak period of beta-hCG levels during pregnancy?
Which of the following is the primary source of beta-hCG during pregnancy?
According to the EPI Schedule of tetanus immunization for pregnant women, when is the first dose of tetanus toxoid administered?
What is placenta previa?

answers.option: Partial or complete absence of the decidua
Placenta invades and perforates uterine wall
Adherence of the placental villous tissue directly to the myometrium
Placenta implants in the lower uterine segment or cervix

question: Which zone of the prostate is commonly involved in benign prostatic hyperplasia?

answers.option: Increased risk of ascending urinary infections

question: In which of the following congenital anomaly of Penis the orifice of the prepuce is too small to permit its normal retraction?

In which of the following congenital anomalies there is complete or partial failure of intra-abdominal testes to descend into the scrotal sac and is associated with testicular dysfunction and increased risk of testicular cancer?

A pregnant woman from a small village, not utilizing antenatal care, began labor. A traditional birth attendant (TBA) was called, but the delivery was attempted at home. The woman bled profusely, and although the TBA suggested going to the hospital, the family delayed. The next morning, she was taken to the hospital, but despite efforts to stop the bleeding and provide a blood transfusion, she passed away. According to the three-delays model, delay in which of the following is the cause of death in this scenario?
What is the simplest measurement to assess the health and maturity of a newborn baby?
When a baby is born, APGAR scoring is done to assess the condition of the baby. When is the APGAR score taken?

answers.option: One minute and five minutes after birth

question: What is the most common cause of death among adolescents globally?
What is the most common cause of maternal mortality in Pakistan?

A young woman complains of abdominal pain during menstruation, and endometrial deposits on the pelvic peritoneum are detected. Which of the following is the most appropriate medical therapy for endometriosis?
A 70-year-old woman is being treated with raloxifene for osteoporosis. What is a concern with this therapy?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?
Which of the following is an acute complication of pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)?

Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an infection that begins in the vulva or vagina and spreads upward to involve most of the structures in the female genital system. Which of the following is a symptom of PID?

Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an infection that begins in the vulva or vagina and spreads upward to involve most of the structures in the female genital system. Which of the following microorganisms is the cause of PID?

A 17-year-old patient attends the Gynecology outpatient department with primary amenorrhea and cyclic abdominal pain. Her BMI is 31 kg/m2. On examination, she is vitally stable. Per abdominal examination, a firm mass of 14-16 cm is felt in the suprapubic region. Local examination reveals a bluish bulging membrane at the introitus. is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old patient presents to the Gynecology outpatient department with primary amenorrhea. Her secondary sexual characteristics are normal. On ultrasound, there is an absence of the uterus and upper vaginal region. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 19-year-old patient presents to the Gynecology outpatient department with primary amenorrhea. On examination, she has a normal BMI and her secondary sexual characteristics are also normal. Her ultrasound shows an absent uterus and normal ovaries. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old nulliparous patient, with a BMI of 31 kg/m², presents to the Gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of irregular and scanty periods for 5 years and secondary amenorrhea for 6 months. Her ultrasound shows a normal-sized uterus with bilaterally enlarged ovaries with multiple follicles arranged at the periphery. What is the most likely diagnosis of this case?
